results.title: Peach and pear harvester
results.brief_description: Picture only. Footage of specialised machine used for quickly removing fruit from peach and pair trees. The machine envelopes a tree and then vibrates which causes the fruit to fall off into a catching device. This is an odd process to view as the tree is shaken quite violently by the machine and the fruit falls into the catching device in a dramamtic fashion.

results.title: Planting quarantine bunchy top
results.brief_description: Brief, unedited footage, largely comprised of shots of banana plantations in Queensland. Nice shots of bunchs of bananas being hoisted through the plantations and suntanned men working. Rich colour. Film tin reads ‘Takes 31-32-33-34’.

results.title: About The White bus
results.creator_credit: John Fletcher, Lindsay Anderson, Marlene Fletcher and Dateline Film Productions
results.brief_description: ‘The White bus’ was a dramatic film directed by Lindsay Anderson about a northern English town. John Fletcher, a friend and colleague of Anderson, has made a film about his friend at work, recording many private moments in the creation of the film; script, production, conferences, location work, editing, dubbing, music laying. An insight into the creative process of film production.

results.title: Melbourne (no. 3)
results.brief_description: Film features quite general shots of Melbourne in the summer. This includes footage of the Great Ocean Road (including panoramas), a busy suburban pool and St. Kilda Beach. These sequences have a great, nostalgic ‘good time’ vibe to them, which is aided in part by the high-contrast film stock. There is also footage of one of Melbourne’s Gardens (possibly the Botanic), including blooming flowers and people looking at them. Nice shots of man burning leaves followed by the sun breaking through smoke haze and trees in garden. Two shots include views of St. Paul’s Cathederal and the Forum Theatre from the Yarra. Nice, Black and White ‘The End’.

results.title: About the human body
results.brief_description: A young boy who goes to a doctor’s office for a physical examination is told about the more important body systems. Explains, using animation, the functions and uses of bones, ligaments and muscles, and demonstrates the working of the nervous, respiratory, digestive and circulatory systems.

results.title: About sex
results.creator_credit: Herman J. Engel and Texture Films
results.brief_description: Provides information to teenagers in a kind of rap session about sexual fantasies, body growth, homosexuality, V.D., masturbation and birth control. Suitable for school years 7-12.

results.title: On the land (ii)
results.brief_description: Montage of colourful shots including a streetscape, livestock and grapepicking. Attractive illustrated title. Sound consists solely of a theme song. The music is upbeat, cheesey and evocative of television programmes of the 1970s and 1980s. Good countdown at begining, some numbers written as words, ie ‘six’ not ‘6’.

results.title: On the land (i)
results.brief_description:
Fast-paced montage of general farm and animal imagery. Seems to be the title sequence for a television series. Ends with a superimposed title. End of reel features an alternative superimposition that reads ‘On the Land S-TV8’.
Soundtrack is comprised solely of up-beat orchestral music.

results.title: About nothing = O nicem
results.creator_credit: William Bukovy, Jan Brychta, Pavel Hobl, Vlastimil Brodsky, Kratky Film and Vstredni Pujcouna Film
results.brief_description: An unusual animated story about a character called “Nothing”, that teases the mind in a delightful and challenging way. “Nothing” gets into the most difficult situations but - after finding a job in a circus he discovers he can successfully help the sad clown and others become happy and able to make fun again. Note: Czechoslovakian language - no subtitles.
